answer: <p>Nowadays you can use lodash' chunk function to split the array into smaller arrays <a href="https://lodash.com/docs#chunk">https://lodash.com/docs#chunk</a> No need to fiddle with the loops anymore!</p>

<pre class="lang-js s-code-block"><code class="hljs language-javascript"><span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> <span class="hljs-attr">coffeescript</span>:

b = (a.<span class="hljs-title function_">splice</span>(<span class="hljs-number">0</span>, len) <span class="hljs-keyword">while</span> a.<span class="hljs-property">length</span>)

demo 
a = [<span class="hljs-number">1</span>, <span class="hljs-number">2</span>, <span class="hljs-number">3</span>, <span class="hljs-number">4</span>, <span class="hljs-number">5</span>, <span class="hljs-number">6</span>, <span class="hljs-number">7</span>]

b = (a.<span class="hljs-title function_">splice</span>(<span class="hljs-number">0</span>, <span class="hljs-number">2</span>) <span class="hljs-keyword">while</span> a.<span class="hljs-property">length</span>)
[ [ <span class="hljs-number">1</span>, <span class="hljs-number">2</span> ],
  [ <span class="hljs-number">3</span>, <span class="hljs-number">4</span> ],
  [ <span class="hljs-number">5</span>, <span class="hljs-number">6</span> ],
  [ <span class="hljs-number">7</span> ] ]
</code></pre>
